title: Fifth Conference on Machine Translation (WMT20)
summary: A two day conference on machine translation with shared tasks.
authors: Barry Haddow, Philipp Koehn, Ondřej Bojar, Christian Federmann, Yvette Graham, Matthias Huck, Christof Monz and Lucia Specia

title: Workshop on Insights from Negative Results in NLP
summary: Let's take a break from chasing leaderboards! Your negative results might save others time, or poke holes in things we take for granted.
authors: Anna Rogers, Joao Sedoc and Anna Rumshisky

title: Search-Oriented Conversational AI (SCAI)
summary: This workshop aims to bring together researchers from the NLP, Machine Learning, and IR communities to lay the ground for search-oriented conversational AI and establish future directions and collaborations.
authors: Julia Kiseleva, Aleksandr Chuklin, Jeff Dalton and Mikhail Burtsev

title: Workshop on Cognitive Modeling and Computational Linguistics (CMCL)
summary: The CMCL workshop provides a venue for computational research on cognitive theories of language processing, representation and acquisition.
authors: Emmanuele Chersoni, Cassandra L. Jacobs, Yohei Oseki, Laurent Prévot and Enrico Santus

title: Interactive and Executable Semantic Parsing (Int-Ex)
summary: Map natural language to meaning representations executed in databases, knowledge graphs, robotic environment and software applications.
authors: Ben Bogin, Srinivasan Iyer, Xi Victoria Lin, Panupong Pasupat, Alane Suhr, Pengcheng Yin, Tao Yu, Rui Zhang, Victor Zhong, Caiming Xiong and Dragomir Radev

title: SustaiNLP: Workshop on Simple and Efficient Natural Language Processing
summary: Promoting computationally efficient NLP and justified model complexity. Encouraging conceptual NLP novelty, discouraging "more compute".
authors: Angela Fan, Goran Glavaš, Shafiq Joty, Nafise Sadat Moosavi, Vered Shwartz, Alex Wang and Thomas Wolf

title: 1st Workshop on Computational Approaches to Discourse
summary: The Workshop on Computational Approaches to Discourse (CODI) covers all aspects of discourse and its computational modeling.
authors: Chloé Braud, Christian Hardmeier, Junyi Jessy Li, Annie Louis and Michael Strube

title: The Fourth Workshop on Online Abuse and Harms (WOAH), previously ‘Abusive Language Workshop' (ALW)
summary: The workshop focuses on online abuse through a multi-disciplinary lens, drawing on social sciences, law, media studies, and more.
authors: Zeerak Waseem, Vinodkumar Prabhakaran, Seyi Akiwowo and Bertie Vidgen

title: NLP and Computational Social Science (NLP+CSS)
summary: This workshop focuses on NLP for Social Sciences, interdisciplinary work in CSS, and integrating CSS with current trends in NLP.
authors: Svitlana Volkova, David Jurgens, David Bamman and Dirk Hovy

title: LOUHI 2020 - 11th International Workshop on Health Text Mining and Information Analysis
summary: an interdisciplinary forum for researchers interested in automated processing of health documents
authors: Alberto Lavelli, James Pustejovsky, Eben Holderness, Antonio Jimeno Yepes, Anne-Lyse Minard and Fabio Rinaldi

title: Evaluation and Comparison of NLP Systems (Eval4NLP)
summary: The workshop focuses on designing evaluation metrics, reporting trustworthy results and creating adequate and correct evaluation data.
authors: Steffen Eger, Yang Gao, Maxime Peyrard, Wei Zhao, Eduard Hovy, Mohit Bansal, Robert West, Ani Nenkova, and Ido Dagan

title: CoNLL 2020
summary: CoNLL is a yearly top-tier NLP conference that has been organized by SIGNLL since 1997.
authors: Raquel Fernández and Tal Linzen

title: 4th Workshop on Structured Prediction for NLP
summary: Structured prediction with continuous representations, task-level supervision and latent linguistic structure.
authors: André F. T. Martins, Andreas Vlachos, Zornitsa Kozareva, Sujith Ravi, Gerasimos Lampouras, Priyanka Agrawal and Julia Kreutzer

title: [WITHDRAWN] Workshop on NLP for Positive Impact
summary: Our workshop aims to promote NLP research that will positively impact society, through proactive and responsible methods. [This workshop has been cancelled]
authors: Maarten Sap, Anjalie Field, Michel Galley, Hannah Rashkin and Bill Dolan

title: First Workshop on Scholarly Document Processing (SDP 2020)
summary: SDP is a full day workshop that provides an interdisciplinary venue for researchers interested in any aspect of mining scientific literature. SDP includes a research track and three shared tasks: 6th CL-SciSumm, 1st LongSumm, 1st LaySumm.
authors: Muthu Kumar Chandrasekaran, Guy Feigenblat, Dayne Freitag, Tirthankar Ghosal, Michal Shmueli-Scheuer, Eduard Hovy, Petr Knoth, David Konopnicki, Philipp Mayr, Robert Patton, Dominika Tkaczyk and Anita de Waard

title: NLP Beyond Text
summary: Can you really know if someone is sarcastic by only reading his texts? If the answer is no, the NLPBT workshop is what you're looking for.
authors: Erik Cambria, Giuseppe Castellucci, Simone Filice, Soujanya Poria, Lucia Specia

title: PrivateNLP 2020: The First Workshop on Privacy in NLP
summary: PrivateNLP focuses on Privacy Preserving systems: differential privacy, anonymized datasets and models, GDPR compliance, and shared tasks!
authors: Oluwaseyi Feyisetan, Sepideh Ghanavati, Patricia Thaine and Shervin Malmasi

title: Second Workshop for NLP Open Source Software (NLP-OSS)
summary: Democratizing NLP: Sharing engineering advances and best practices for open sourcing software in NLP
authors: Masato Hagiwara, Eunjeong Park, Dmitrijs Milajevs, Nelson F. Liu, Liling Tan and Geeticka Chauhan

title: Spatial Language Understanding
summary: Spatial Language Understanding, Learning/Reasoning on Spatial Semantics, (sub)Symbolic Representations and Grounding Language in Perception
authors: Malihe Alikhani, Jason Baldridge, Mohit Bansal, Archna Bhatia, Parisa Kordjamshidi and Marie-Francine Moens

title: SIGTYP 2020: The Second Workshop on Computational Research in Linguistic Typology
summary: Bringing together researchers interested in applying computational techniques to problems in linguistic typology and multilingual NLP.
authors: Yevgeni Berzak, Ryan Cotterell, Anna Korhonen, Roi Reichart, Eitan Grossman, Haim Dubossarsky, Arya D. McCarthy, Edoardo Maria Ponti, Ivan Vulić and Ekaterina Vylomova

title: 3rd Clinical Natural Language Processing Workshop (Clinical NLP 2020)
summary: Explore challenges and promises of clinical text: understand a patient's story, predict health outcomes, advance medical research, and more.
authors: Anna Rumshisky, Steven Bethard, Kirk Roberts and Tristan Naumann

title: Deep Learning Inside Out (DeeLIO): The First Workshop on Knowledge Extraction and Integration for Deep Learning Architectures
summary: Deep Learning Inside Out: Knowledge Extraction and Integration for Deep Learning Architectures with special focus on low-data regimes
authors: Eneko Agirre, Marianna Apidianaki and Ivan Vulić

title: 6th Workshop on Noisy User-generated Text (W-NUT 2020)
summary: Social media, crowdsourcing, medical texts, language learner essays, and more! 2 keynotes, 130 PC members, talks and 1-min madness for posters
authors: Wei Xu, Alan Ritter, Timothy Baldwin, Afshin Rahimi and Leon Derczynski

title: BlackboxNLP 2020: Analyzing and interpreting neural networks for NLP
summary: Open the black-box of neural networks in NLP and make sense of the big pile of goo inside it
authors: Yonatan Belinkov, Afra Alishahi, Grzegorz Chrupała, Dieuwke Hupkes, Yuval Pinter and Hassan Sajjad

title: NLP for COVID-19 Workshop (Part 2)
summary: Analysing and understanding text and speech data to combat the COVID-19 Pandemic.
authors: Karin Verspoor, Mike Conway, Berry de Bruijn, Mark Dredze, Rada Mihalcea and Byron Wallace
